intro: Bidens triplinervia var. hirtella, commonly known as hairy ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in wetland habitats and is often found along the edges of swamps and marshes. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
